data.title: Typescript file formatting four spaces instead of two
data.body: I am trying to format typescript files. VS Code does format my code, but it used 4 spaces instead of 2 spaces. Am I missing something?

data.title: Intellisense not working
data.body:
I've upgraded the `vs code` to the latest version ,and the `Salsa` was enabled. 
Now, the code intellisense does not work without an `jsconfig.json` file. but version `0.10.6` worked well.

![withoutjsconfig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/13038969/c759c192-d3d4-11e5-886b-416eca15dfb6.png)
![withjsconfig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/13038976/e14ab20a-d3d4-11e5-837b-319fbe02638b.png)

data.title: quickOpen broke again
data.body:
it seems I met the same issue like https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1007
When I press ctrl+p, vscode only show recenty opened files whatever I input
It has been ok before I updated to 0.10.8

data.title: show exception breakpoint options only if returned as capabilities
Editor feature request : toUpperCase / toLowerCase command
data.body:
Please, add a command to capitalize the selected text, this is a very useful feature in my opinion.

Thanks !

data.title: File picker doesn't open file with full path
data.body:
According to Visual Code 0.10.8 changelog, it's now possible to open a file by typing it's full disk path:

> You can open any file (including line/column pattern at the end) that exists on disk by typing the full     path.

But I can't get it to open any file outside my workspace. For example, I have a file stored in e:\foo\bar.php

When typing something like `e:\foo\bar.php` in the file picker it says file `no results found` although the file exists (and can be read).

Maybe I misread the changelog and it only works for opening files inside the workspace ?

Visual Code 0.10.8-insiders
Windows 10 (64bit)

data.title: Searching Text in folders is very slow compared to notepad++
data.body:
Hi , 
VSCode Searching some text in files specially when there is about 30K + files in folders and sub folders is very very slow compared to even notepad++ 

Rather then showing results at the end it should show when it find one result in the folder and keep searching it also one more thing the search result should be in new tab rather then below to search field / tab as it shows very less space in results.

data.title: access electron API from vscode extension
data.body:
Hi,

is there currently a way or is it planned for the future that we can access the electron shell API from VS-Code extensions ?

I would like to implement an extension using the [BrowserWindow API of electron](http://electron.atom.io/docs/v0.36.7/api/browser-window/#class-browserwindow) (more specifically the [BrowserWindow.getAllWindows() API](http://electron.atom.io/docs/v0.36.7/api/browser-window/#browserwindowgetallwindows)), but I can't find any way to get access to that from the scope of an extension.

Thanks

data.title: VS code portable
data.body: Would be nice to have portable version of VS Code like sublime. I always don't have install permissions.

data.title: Tune debug accessibility
data.body:
- [x] After pressing F5 to launch the app under the debugger the debugger should announce "Debugger launched" before the app starts up and the screen reader starts announcing from the app.
- [x] When a breakpoint is hit, we should announce "breakpoint hit filename linenumber". If it's a conditional breakpoint, announce "conditional breakpoint hit filename linenumber". We discussed whether or not to announce the conditional expression but thought that it might be too verbose to do so.
- [x] Inside the debug viewlet, when browsing the list of variables we should reduce the verbosity as much as possible. For example, consider just announcing the name of the variable or field rather than prefixing it with "variable"

data.title: [themes] Flattening of text mate scopes leads to wrong coloring
data.body: - Open nodeAppInsightsTelemtryAppender.ts#40 - Notice broken colouring of comments inside contructor arguments Other problematic languages with deep scope hierarchies: - JSX tags - Java

data.title: 404 error when clicking on one of the download links
data.body:
When I click on the download for Linux x64 button on the top part of the site I am redirected to a 404 page.

When I click on the download for Linux x64 on the bottom of the page (the one underneath the penguin icon) the link works fine.

Looking at the markup I think it's just missing the 64 in the data os tag.

data.title: Debug Console does not support special codes (Colors, clear line etc.)
data.body:
An example:

```
Starting work...
[2K[1GProgress 0%[2K[1GProgress 9.03%[2K[1GProgress 17.51%[2K[1GProgress 27.11%[2K[1GProgress 35.59%
```

Those `[2K[1G` codes are printed to `stdout` in order to clear the line and move the cursor to the left. Such codes are used by any terminal program to control what's on the screen, including programs such as `vim` and so.

Colors are not mandatory in the debugger console, but controlling the cursor is - as it can confuse the poor bastard trying to understand what's going on from the terminal output.

data.title: Salsa preview doesn't seem to work
data.body: Setting `export VSCODE_TSJS=1` in my `.bash_profile` and updating my project to use the latest Typescript@next doesn't work. I've noticed that sometimes I see the `(Salsa)` indicator show up very briefly when starting up the editor, but it disappears right away.

data.title: Documentation for Docker is out of date
data.body: The [documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/dockerfile) on the VSCode website leads the reader to think that Docker support should work out of the box. I presume that was not intended, as you must first install the extension.

data.title: shift+tab is deleting the code ...
data.body:
![shift-tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/949380/13030590/73fad894-d265-11e5-97bd-36f2db4481a9.gif)

Please note the key pressed at the `bottom-left` corner of the animation.

Steps to reproduce:
- Highlight a block of code
- Press Shift + Tab
- Notice the state of the editor, most of the selected code is deleted
- Pressing CMD + Z does not bring back the deleted code.

`VSCode version: 0.10.8`
`OS: OS X 10.10.5`

Is it only me?

data.title: [Question] How can i get all errors and warnings for entire project?
data.body: Currently VSCode just showing me errors and warnings for open files. I couldn't find any issue or settings that expand scanning for errors in all entire project or specific folder. is it by design or I miss something?

I'm on the Angular 2 train.  Took the beta 6 update via an npm update.  When I switched to Code, I noticed this peculiarity - I see the *.d.ts files, but I don't see any of the *.ts files.  I reinstalled node from the msi for good measure.  Still, no joy.

Thanks for any help that you might be able to provide.

Vitals:
Code v0.10.8
Node.js: v5.6.0
npm: v3.7.2
typings: v0.6.8

data.title: Selection matches not shown in scrollbar anymore
data.body:
In every previous version I was able to just select some string and was able to see all matching strings positions in the scrollbar, just like with the search function - but now it seems this feature is missing.
Pictures are worth a thousand words:
Now:
![vs1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7961978/13028925/02bc7a7a-d27e-11e5-9cd4-42ae840861f7.png)

How it was before (now only achieved while using the search `ctrl+f`):
![vs2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7961978/13028924/02b99580-d27e-11e5-9692-b13af08b31e9.png)

What's wrong with this feature? Removed? Broken? Disabled?

data.title: Selection should include character under block cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Implementing a block cursor is maybe not as straightforward as first seemed.  When there are active selections and the cursor type is a block cursor, the column that the cursor is shown to occupy is supposed to be considered part of the selection.
### STR
1. With a block cursor enabled, type "foo bar baz" in a new document
2. Using the mouse, try to select the entire word "foo"
3. Copy and paste it into some scratch space
4. Move the cursor over the "b" in "bar"
5. Using Shift+Right Arrow, select the entire word
### Expected Results

Pasting in step 3 pastes the entire word "foo", and selecting the word "bar" with the keyboard in step 5 should leave the block cursor blinking over the "r", or alternatively, leave no visible trace of the cursor at all, while the selection is active.
### Actual Results

The paste step in 3 only pastes "fo", and using the keyboard for selection in step 5 hints towards why: after selecting "bar", the block cursor is shown hovering over the space that follows instead of the "r" at the end of the word.

data.title: Switching workspaces toggles menubar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Using Gnome on Ubuntu.

When switching from another workspace using the keyboard shortcut, vscode unhides the menu bar when Alt gets released.

Compare to Firefox, which also does the press-Alt-to-show-menubar thing, but doesn't exhibit this bug.

Possibly related: #2951, #1305

data.title: [json] [0.10.8] Wrapping JSON with double quotes replaces the text
data.body:
In <= 0.10.5, you could highlight text in a JSON file and wrap it in double quotes:

![wrap_0105](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16483697/13028604/7fc9452e-d26b-11e5-9894-0569c23296e6.gif)

In 0.10.8, the highlighted text is now replaced with a double quote rather than wrapped:

![wrap_0108](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16483697/13028612/c408244e-d26b-11e5-92f7-dcb7df9f48db.gif)

---

Seen in VSCode 0.10.8, 64-bit, on both Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.10.

No errors in dev console. No change in behaviour when VSCode is started with the --disable-extensions flag.

data.title: Test code folding
data.body:
**Assignment**
- [x] Win @weinand 
- [x] Mac @joaomoreno 
- [x] Linux @Tyriar 

**Details**
- test that you can see the folding gutter between line numbers and line start
  - test that turning off folding (setting `editor.folding`) remove the gutter
  - test that you can see folding arrows when the cursor is over the glyph section
  - test that collapsed region arrows are always visible
  - test that arrows look good in different themes and different editor settings (font size, line height, no line numbers...)
  - test that arrows play well with git decorations and any other possible line decorators
- test that collapse regions are rendered with `...`
  - test that you can click on the ellipses and that this expands the section
- test the folding commands and keyboard shortcuts
  - Fold (Ctrl+ Shift + [) folds the innermost uncollapsed region at the cursor
  - Unfold (Ctrl+ Shift + ]) unfolds the collapsed region at the cursor
  - Fold All (Ctrl+ Shift + Alt + [) folds all region in the editor
  - Unfold All (Ctrl+ Shift + Alt + ]) unfolds all regions in the editor
- test editing with collapsed reguosn
  - cut/copy paste
  - typing
  - formatting
  - find/replace
  - multicursor

data.title: Ctrl+` keyboard shortcut (Cycle Between Opened Editors) not usable with Norwegian keyboard layout
data.body:
The ` symbol is not easily accessible on a Norwegian keyboard layout, effectively rendering the Ctrl+` keyboard shortcut unusable. The pipe symbol | is located on the Norwegian keyboard layout where the ` symbol is located on the English keyboard layout.

Suggestion: Allow for using | as a keyboard shortcut replacement for ` on Norwegian keyboard layouts. (Other keyboard layouts will probably need to be addressed, too.)

data.title: refactor AIAdatper out of ai telemetry appender
data.body:
This change refactors the application insight wrapper logic outside of the `nodeAppInsightsTelemetryAppender`.

App Insights requires special logic to make sure that the client is setup with the correct properties, as well as making sure we disable all non-required collections. 

With this change, `AIAdapter` is now available in base/node as dependency to be used anywhere in the codebase. Taking this to base is intensionally not to have any tie between Application Insights and the telemetry service as they are not coupled from architecture perspective.
